text:
We made it to Vegas about 4 hours earlier than expected, which put us here at 5am on a Sunday.  Unable to check into our hotel and not wanting to leave our car too unattended with the luggage in it, we ended up at MadHouse.  

The drip coffee was very good (not burnt or over exposed like a lot of 24hour places). I had the best coconut latte I've ever tried- you could actually taste the coconut! They were playing good music. It was small but not overcrowded with junk like some other chain coffee places (*cough*). We didnt try any food because the pastries looked a little dry, but according to the menu they are made in house.  And the best part is that it had lots of windows so we could keep an eye on the car. Overall a great place to kill a few hours.

Have been wanting to try it here for a while now and I was pleasantly surprised. Coffee had a great flavor to it and the lox bagel was awesome as well. My only complaint was that I wish the bagel had been a little more toasted. Other than that it was awesome

Waited for over 10 minutes to get our order taken (should have walked out then) then waited an additional 10 minutes to get our order. The breakfast sandwich was microwaved and the latte could be found anywhere else in the valley.

I'm a regular at Starbucks, but wanted to support a locally owned business - coffee (got an Americano) was delicious and the menu options are fantastic.

Only slight issue came down to the baked goods - croissant was still cold and didn't have great flavor.  

I'm definitely going back and will try something else!

Pros:  The drinks are delicious, from light and refreshing Italian sodas to succulent hot coffee drinks (served in glass mugs if you wish) to decadent blended coffee(or not) drinks I don't find it a small thing that they use the tiny, almost crushed, ice cubes (No pun intended.) It makes iced drinks so much more delicious to me. Lots of sweets/pastries.(but priced high.)  The Green Card sandwich (turkey, cheddar, bacon and guacamole) was delish.  Various healthy and vegan choices, even almond, coconut, and hemp milk for your drinks.  The coffee beans' flavor is so rich and not bitter.... Board games to play.... Menu is a lot easier to read/understand at this location, rather than the DI location .... I like it when their music is chill or jazz, anything without lyrics so you can hear each other talking better and be able to read/work better too. :) .....

Cons:.   The prices are a little high, especially for the quality/quantity of the food.  Herbal tea choices are sparse....Only one outdoor table.  Unexpected for a coffeehouse....  the prices are a little high, especially for the quality/quantity of the food.  The tuna sandwich is flavoress and dripping in mayo-type spread......
I like their hazelnut coffee, nice outdoor seating, ample parking.

I enjoy stooping here in the morning to read and do some net browsing.  You get free Wi-Fi if you buy a drink, which for me is a great combo!  I can sip my coffee and snoop through Google News.  :)  Nice people and good brew...so I keep going back.
I love this place! The coffee, the food, especially the people! Service with heart and joy and true care for the customer.

Outstanding coffee! Friendly staff. Complete opposite of Starbucks and I'm saying that as a compliment! We stop by there anytime we're in the area. I wish there was one closer to the house. Go by and check them out!!!

This is my first time, but I am impressed. Affordable prices for great tastes. Because it is the Super Bowl day, the cafe is seemingly quiet, but I'm sure it gets busy. Plus, they have a drive-thru station which is just as good as it gets. The place is very small, but very homey. The staff smiles and greets you when you enter and greets you farewell when you leave. That, for me, earns points. The drinks are pretty good for their prices. I would definitely visit this place again. Free internet but is only free for 120 minutes. Regardless, very nice place.

Ok...so stumbled across this cute place on our way to another coffee shop!  We spotted Madhouse coffee and are so happy we did!  I had a vanilla late which was good, and my coffee partner had an iced red velvet ( yummy!). Pesto sandwich aka the wannabe was delicious. The environment was perfect to study in or hang with a friend. Very cozy.

I returned to Madhouse coffee upon re-visiting Las Vegas. My wife and I loved the coffee shop in the past. Unfortunately, it does not seem as special as it once did. I did not feel as much at home as once before. I thought this place was better than the other (unrelated) location on Desert Inn Rd, but not it seems to be the same. I visited a new place called, "Grouchy John's Coffee" on S. Maryland Pkwy the other day and that place was unique, inviting, and excellent. Unfortunately, something has changed at Mad House Cafe to take away from it's lure the past few years worth of visits.

I agree with other reviews here. The drinks are overpriced for the quality. I was not particularly happy with my latte. It was not as good as any of the chain coffee shops I have had.

The inside is nice for being small. They have a handful of board games and coloring books for kids. It is rather loud, however, because it is small. The small outside area has two tables (a previous review said it only had one), but unfortunately they permit people to smoke here.

This comes up as an It's A Grind location but it isn't. I tried it anyway. I had a blended coconut latte and it was all pre mixed. No fresh shot of espresso. Very sweet and disappointing for a $6 drink. It was a cute spot and maybe their other drinks we good. Looks like they have food too. I'm giving them a three stars in case I just had a bad experience.

Great coffee and I love that they have a wide selection of non-dairy milks, including coconut milk. 

Also, I especially felt compelled to write a review because I was there with my 2-month-old baby and another mama and her 5-month-old and the workers there treated us with wonderful respect, even accommodating a diaper change. Even the other patrons were super polite. I never know what to expect in public places as a first time mama and a baby and it was a pleasant surprise to be able to go to a public place that mostly caters to adults and have awesome customer service. Thank you, Madhouse!
I love their coffee. Much better than Starbucks and without the ridiculous line. Their sandwiches are awesome as well. I am addicted!
Coffee and my bagel sandwich was fantastic. Also the atmosphere is really calm and warm. This will probably become are new little hang out,
A great coffee house. The muffins are awesome and my personal favorite is the choc chip. The baristas are friendly and efficient . So much better than sbuks in every way

They have the best drinks, they get creative with you drink they always surprise me!! Love the crew very polite and the family is extremely friendly. I recommend this place to anyone! I was a Starbucks customer but these people beets anything Starbucks does! 
 Chai latte

So grossed out right now I can't even wrap my head around what I just saw.  One of the male middle eastern workers nonchalantly sticks his hand down the front of his pants, scratches himself when he thinks no one is looking, then continues making food.  Ill never go back after seeing that animal do that, so freaking gross.  Its a shame because all the female baristas are always so nice and helpful, and I used to really enjoy their coffee.

Mad House is great! There's no corporate stuff going on here, you ask for something they do their best to provide it. They are super friendly, and the product quality is excellent. The food and baked items are great as well!
Best coffee in Vegas! I had the greatest experience here, the staff is so friendly and the owners are so nice. I had the most amazing coffee. I would definitely recommend everyone to come here!

Madhouse has such a handsome young man working in the evenings, I think his name is Nolan. He is so welcoming and personable and he makes the BEST sandwiches and wraps I have ever tasted. It is a pleasure going in there when he's there. If you haven't popped into Madhouse yet you're missing out.

Great coffee, down to earth Barista's, very friendly owners (I personally met both, I was a frequent flyer though #GraduateSchoolStruggle), great food selection with *delicious* vegetarian options, down-to-earth customers, and awesome thought-provoking artwork. 

When I decided to leave Las Vegas, I knew that I was also leaving a second "home," I was a regular, and I always felt comfortable getting work done. There were a few times when I would get into really great conversations with Las Vegas locals, and I actually bought a good deal of artwork from Recycled Propaganda whose work you'll see around the caf√©. Now that I'm settled back on the East coast, I miss my West coast staple. However, I know that it's a place that I can go to where I can feel at peace and be around good people. I even ran into friends here (and I hadn't told them about Madhouse), though people love it and they have the business to prove it.

I say all this to say that I miss Mad House, I miss the Barista's, I miss Marco and his wife, and they made it that much more difficult to move when I left. However, they will always be a shining star during my 2 years in Las Vegas. With that said, when I'm back in town vacationing, I will definitely go out of my way to drop by and say hello, and absorb the good vibes of Mad House.

We have been going to Madhouse coffee on Eastern for about a year now. After getting stale pastries and watered down coffee from the manager who works on Saturdays,  I was concerned when two of their best employees left. 

When I called the store to find out when the owner was going to be at the Eastern location, I was unaware that the manager's relative put my call on speaker phone so the manager could hear my comments without my permission. 

The next day, the manager confronted me in front of 10 customers and asked if I was the one who left a message to speak to the owner.  I was not prepared for the conversation and nor did I want to voice my concerns to someone who was looking for a fight and in a crowded coffee shop.
 
If you don't care how hard you work for your money, then you can continue buying your coffee fix from them. But if you want to be respected for your business, then find another place to purchase your fix. This place does not care about customers since the manager was being confrontational with me in front of customers and lied about the product being fresh. She can't even make a good cup of coffee.  Customers shouldn't be expected to defend themselves if they have a problem with product they are paying for. 

Side note: the owner did call and try to make a mends but it was a little too late for that. With their prices, its not worth it.

O.M.G!! The monkey mocha is amazing.  There might be a day's worth of calories in one large drink... But dang... It's worth it!  The sandwiches were yummy too!  We look forward to stopping in every visit!

Wanted to try a new coffee place on a Saturday and boy I shouldn't have! I waited approx 30 + min for a packaged oatmeal and Chai Tea. It was 10am and they were already out of bagels and crossaints! This is why I had to settle with packaged oatmeal. There were many angry customers waiting as well. Looked like a cool place but definitely will not be returning to. Oh and their Chai was not very good, entire cup was ice leaving little Chai and they charged me more than what was advertised on their menu!

Drove by this place, and decided to give it a try, I am a huge coffee snob, and like a certain type of coffee drink.  Went through the drive thru, and decided to try something different for a change.  I opted for their famous Red Velvet coffee.  It was so good, like drinking cake.  I will be back when I am in the area.
Fast and friendly.  My only issue is by Sunday their foodstuffs are pretty picked over.  We love these guys!

I am so disappointed in my experience with madhouse. The owner reached out to me after I made a past complaint about a bad employee who gave herself a tip on my debit card without my authorization (the employee asked me if I wanted to tip, I said no because she'd already been rude, then she gave herself a tip anyways). The owner asked for my address because she wanted to send a gift card as apology, but I never received anything. I never cared about the gift card itself.. What I cared about was that she offered something with no intent of following through. I contacted her about it and my contact was completely ignored. Once a very regular customer who highly recommended this spot to all my friends... I now have refused to give them my business or anyone I knows business for several months now due to sloppy management and customer service.

Read about It's A Grind Coffee House in Vegas & wanted to try it.  This location is at 8899 S. Eastern Ave @ Pebble Rd.  It has a Drive-In.

I got:

Nutty Cow (hazelnut latte) $3.05 for single 12oz.  It's sweet & just average.  Like Starbucks without the lines or buzz.

Cafe Latte $2.85 for Single 12oz.  B. thought it tasted like warm milk.  

Charged it.  Nothing special about their coffee, do they have Peets in Vegas yet?

Great customer service. They have a great selection of items to choose from. It's cheaper than Starbucks and you get bigger sizes, a 32oz for about $7.00 depending on the flavor and they taste just as good. New favorite place to get my morning fix.

Coffee's pretty good.  Service sucks.  Waited 3 minutes at the counter while the barista's chatted with no one in front of me.  Eventually got a "Oh sorry.  Have you been helped?" (I was literally 5 feet in front of them at the counter the whole time).  Ordered a cappuccino and a chocolate croissant.  After some searching around the Barista eventually found me (sitting at the counter right next to where I was just standing), and delivered my Cappuccino and said, "I'll be right back with your chocolate croissant".  Then proceeded back behind the counter and continued chatting with the other barista.  I never got my croissant.  Was tempted to get up and ask, but by then I had finished my coffee and there was a line of other customers ordering.  I left that dingy place.  Won't be back.

We bought a restaurant.com which was $10 for $20 worth of purchases. After looking over the menu and deciding what to buy, the cashier took our order and hit "validate" on our voucher before knowing what to do with it. She called the manager over who began to try and say that he never put his coffee shop on restaurant.com and that they did it "without permission" and he would not accept the groupon. After being upset because we had already purchased the groupon and the cashier had validated it, he said he would only honor a 20% off our order. He tried arguing with us about what we paid for the original voucher and we ended up just walking out. 

Here's a tip: even if you took your business off restaurant.com "2 weeks ago", you still need to honor the customers that bought one. We will NEVER be back. I've been here once before and the coffee was nothing to rave about and no cheaper than Starbucks. And combined with awful customer service like that, they won't make it very far.

I've been visiting this cafe about once every other week for a bit.

Pros, good taste in music.  Everything from retro 80s electronic pop, to classy jazz and blues, to trip hop.  The Baristas are intelligent, friendly, and conversational in a genuine way.  The decor of this place is a fun mixture of dense blue against brightly decorated tables and a few ruddy colored paintings.  The coffee itself is always good here as well, but I admit I've tried anything but simple drip coffees.  The various sandwiches are tasty.  Today, I had "the supermodel"  "Would you like a wrap, sandwich, or naked?" the Barista asks.  I pause, "you're asking if I want the supermodel naked?"

Cons?  Really, I got nothing to complain about.  I admit, I regret that this place only has two electric outlets for customers.  However, the Baristas proved accommodating in providing an "over the counter" electric cord for me to use.
This is our favorite coffee place! I usually get a medium or large iced coffee with soy. The iced coffee is fantastic! Especially on a hot summer day.
Great location with drive thru . Very good service. Great product.  I'd say twice as good as Starbucks. The inside is very cool.

Sadly disappointed. I was craving a bagel with cream cheese so bad so I ordered through Postmates. They don't give you bagel/cream cheese option so I had to order lox bagel and pay double. I stated in the notes I wanted it toasted with plain cream cheese, which they still put the lox/tomato/capers on which I don't eat so I had to take it off and then there was barely any cream cheese so basically just ate bread. :( The everything bagel tasted pretty good but again there was baaaarely any cream cheese, maybe covered half
I freaking love this place, it's simple, to the point, and the coffee is awesome.  Everything I love about a Coffee place.

Don't get me wrong - I LOVE the coffee here. It's fantastic. So much so that I came here almost every day for a month and a half to get myself and the hubs our daily brew. Today, I was charged $6.50 for a medium soy vanilla latte because "the owners want to start charging for the soy milk". I can understand an up charge but $1.50 extra per drink for soy milk?!? What the heck! That's outrageous and more than grouchy johns and Starbucks. Ridiculous.
Very good stuff! Friendly and efficient staff, comfortable and original decor, and excelllent product.

My visits here are few and far between, to be honest. But on all those occasions when I have come here, I always go inside the shop because there is always a line at the drive thru and I'm not so lazy on those times that I do visit this coffee shop. BUT EVERY SINGLE TIME I COME HERE, I am never acknowledged right away even as I am standing there in front of their register. I understand they are busy but a quick "hi, I'll be right with you" would suffice. I'm a patient person, I don't mind waiting. But not to be acknowledged as the baristas go about ringing up the drive thru and making the drive thru coffee order is a bit rude. Now that I've gotten that off my chest, on to the coffee: I always get either the white mocha or the mad cow. The coffee doesn't disappoint, but their customer service needs work. Maybe I'll just go thru the drive thru next time.

A nice spot, small place, art on the walls, cool music, and games on the shelves to play, including giant tic-tac-toe.  Good range of coffee, teas(i think), and frozen drinks.  Very friendly staff and owner.  Also clean and free wifi. I recommend! Wish they were open later. I understand there is another one across town that is 24 hrs (different owner)...

I had a very poor experience. The staff was loud and screaming at each other, cursing, and complaining about not getting a big enough tip from a drive through customer. They were pleasant to me personally but they did not represent the coffee shop very well. The music was so loud I could hardly read my book while I ate. My food and drink was great, too bad my experience wasn't the same.

Read great reviews so I was really excited to try, but wasn't very impressed. A friend and I got the flat white and red velvet mocha, both very very flavorless. The snickerdoodles tasted like fig newtons. The gluten free chocolate chip cookies were okay.

I am a pastry student and when i saw the words "gormet bakery" i thought hey this place could make their stuff... no i find out that the only thing they make IN HOUSE is their tiramisu everything else is made offsite... in France... so i thought ok lets get some kind of hot chocolate... they gave me dark chocolate pudding in a cup and not even good dark chocolate... i could only take a little bit before the taste was just terrible.

Gonna give them a four star even the early morning guy working the window is a little lame.  As in probably stoned.  The coffee is good and hot and they use a decent coffee roast so my latte tastes like coffee which is a plus.  I drive through pretty early so maybe the staff just isn't completely awake or maybe he is truly just a little too laid back.  Prices in line with everyone else's.

I love this little place! It's a fun, unique atmosphere and the drinks are wonderful. The mango-green tea smoothie is perfectly refreshing and rejuvenating. And the customer service is probably the best coffee house service I've had. Smiling, professional, and helpful staff...and great baristas to boot!

I've gone here about 5 to 10 times to give it a shot and honestly if you're not getting coffee it's a waste of money. We always order through post mates or uber eats at work and I love the blended nutella. Definitely wakes me up for a 12 hour shift. However if I'm hungry or want dessert, I always get annoyed for paying for an over priced sandwich. The sandwiches are small, bland, and basic. If they were cheap it'd be fine but they are like 1/3 of the size of a subway sandwich and you're paying 9 to 12 bucks! I've had the bread pudding, creme brulee, and nutella creme brulee which were all disappointing. I definitely don't consider those creme brulee OR bread pudding, and I've had my fair share. I've tried so hard to like this place but the only thing I ever enjoy is that blended nutella white mocha. And that's only on nights I'm okay being diabetic.

This is a small coffee shop, they do like to have their music a bit loud. Maybe because there's not that many people here? It's an OK place. I ordered a dark chocolate ice blended since it's my favorite drink at any coffee shop, it's lack of taste here. I couldn't drink it even after I tried fixing it. Maybe I'll get something else next time? The service is ok. That's why I give a 4 start.

Wrong marker on map. The map on yelp places the coffee house on the wrong location. The coffee house is actually on the corner of Pebble and Eastern, next to Super Burrito. It's a nice small coffee house, with 120 minutes of free wifi with purchase. I was looking for a place to have lunch and stick around to study. It's a small place, with seating for about 18 people, plus another 8 outside. It's not so busy around lunchtime, so it was perfect. I had the Rabbit Habit sandwich and it was delicious!! I also had a chai tea, which did not disappoint. The servers were all very nice and pleasant. Sandwich was served promo and warm.

Coffee and service horrible! Asked for a caramel frapp and employee blended full glass of ice with latte and some caramel. This is how the employee said he made it. The consistency came out almost completely solid and it looked very unappetizing. So after I asked him to re-blend it, he did. The drink tasted like milk and really gross. Adding more caramel would not have helped. I was not looking for hundreds of calories from too much caramel! Instead of offering us another drink or refund, employee ignored us.  Plus charged about $7.00 for it! I guess they do not care they are losing customers!
Get a new recipe for the drink!!!

Started going back to this place recently and remembered why I like it so much more than Starbucks/Coffee Bean.  But they make the best chai lattes in town.  A tad more expensive than Starbucks, but worth it.  Another plus: the people who work there seem a lot more "real" than those who wear matching black shirts and green aprons.

Small venue, but the place is worth it.  They have a variety of unique drinks and foods.  My favorite was the Godfather sandwich.  Their breakfast sandwiches are delicious, too.  All the sandwiches are made to order, so you get them fresh.

Staff is friendly, and atmosphere is always chill.  Good alternative to the hustle and bustle of Starbucks.  It's a great local place.

Great coffee, Baristas are nice 
Nice not hoity toity atmosphere. The Lox box was fabulous

I have given this place SO MANY chances and every time multiple things are wrong with my order. The best part of this place is that the employees are nice. But nice is the only positive thing I can say about them. My order takes over 15 minutes every time, the menu is not updated and some of the sandwiches have different ingredients then advertised, they forget certain ingredients that ARE listed and it's always cold. For the lack of consistency, the prices are extremely high. Not impressed!

Consistency is key when it comes to coffee! Love this place. One (rare) case I got my usual coffee and it wasn't as strong as how I normally get it. So I called and told them. They without question offered to make me another one at no charge. Since I already drove off and was already home I asked if I could just come the next day. The next day the remade my coffee and it was perfect. Excellent customer service and coffee! Thanks mad house!

I'm a fan.  There's your typical Dunkin' Donuts and Starbucks type coffee shops and then there's Mad House Coffee.  Upon walking in, I was greeted by a friendly order taker and an inviting atmosphere.  The walls are decorated with different painted artwork and wall hangings.  Nothing generic about this place.  The have board games and books along with quaint seating.  They offer a pretty expansive coffee menu along with sandwiches and pastries.  My coffee needs are basic so it was a hot coffee blend of the day, Hawaiian hazelnut (awesome!).  Our friendly order taker brought us our coffee in big mugs and offered a refill.  Good service + good coffee = happiness :)
Went here this morning, had the breakfast bagel and a mango smoothie. The service was really great and the food/smoothie was awesome. Thanks guys!

Loved it!  My daughter and I went there for lunch and were very happy with our order, as our sandwiches were delicious!  I had their capri sandwich on ciabatta and my daughter had the turkey/bacon on ciabatta.  I didn't get the name of the guy behind the counter, but he was awesome!  Very friendly and willing to answer all of our questions about our sandwiches.  We are definitely going back :)
Stopped in for a iced Chai and I loved every sip. Not too much ice. The best tasting Chai I have had in a long long time. I will definitely be back. A must stop in for every coffee and tea lover.
They open 24hrs, and drive thru staff is friendly(except young lady, she always look so tired that's why i didnt give a 5 stars) and very fast order i love this place
very clean with very friendly staff and free wi-fi. Who could ask for more of a coffee place? And they can make a skinny latte!
Happy by Pharrell played an uncountable number of times I'm confused ???? Coffee is good tho

Iced Red Velvet Mocha FTW.

& two thumbs up for the drive-thru.

Every time I come to this place I'm always disappointed. I stopped here because I needed coffee STAT. I was the only person in the drive-through. I placed my order. One medium coffee with almond milk and one Splenda. That's all. I get to the window the lady asked me what my order was. At this point I've already tipped her one dollar and I'm hesitant on asking for it back. A different lady give me my coffee and asked me if I had ordered anything else. Omg 
Get with it guys.

Great coffee and smoothies.  The hospitality and friendliness of the staff was awesome.  The manager even offered me a sample of his sliders to get some feedback on whether it was any good.  I hold good values and customer service to a high standard and I enjoyed hanging out at this coffee shop while I had to do some work.  Check it out!

Customer service was great. Went through the drive thru. Ordered a peanut butter, chocolate Monkey type  drink? It was a little gritty for my taste and not as sweet as I would like. If I'm in the area I'll stop by again and try something different.
Owner is super nice and if anything isn't to your liking he'll fix it. Coffee is yummy. And they have a lot of choices for food and coffee here

Great stop as we leave Vegas.  Local coffee shop with Super friendly service, nice atmosphere and free wifi! 

Food was yummy (bagel, cheese and egg sandwich) and the prices reasonable.  The ice blended drinks were good and tasted like they had less sugar than a Starbucks counterpart (we enjoyed that!).

I've never had bad experiences at this place until quite recently. My boyfriend and I went there for breakfast this week, ordered a sandwich, two lattes, and a muffin and we couldn't stop ranting about how bad the food was on the way home. The lattes had a terrible aftertaste and the muffin honestly tasted like something you'd get from 7-11. And it was a bizarre neon yellow color. Very unappetizing. We were mostly just frustrated because we've been coming to madhouse for years and have always enjoyed the food/drinks. I always recalled the lattes being excellent and made with the actual tea bags instead of syrup. And the pastries being delicious and homemade. We both decided not to frequent madhouse anymore, especially after dropping 20 bucks for food we ended up throwing away when we got home.

This is probably the least favorite coffee place I been to in Vegas so far.
I ordered the white Nutella and my friend had the grasshopper.

I thought there would be some sort of espresso in there but there was none. I should've added a shot in there to bring some boost. The quality of the frappe was like an ice slushy. Liquid syrup stayed on the bottom and ice particles stayed on top. Quality was super bad and it tasted like drinking sweet syrup.

The coffee is great and so are the ice blended drinks. The employees are friendly and it's always very clean. The grasshopper is my favorite from the cold drinks. It's mint chocolate mocha blended with ice. The vanilla latte is good, similar to Starbucks. The coffee of the day is better than anywhere else. You need to get there early if you want muffins or breakfast pastry because they run out.

Mad House is definitely over hyped. The vibe here feels very high school-ish and their drinks are average. I had very high expectations for this place, but unfortunately its just another crazy looking coffee shop.

Delicious, cheap, and great customer service. It's Starbucks without the crowd. The employees were genuinely kind and the place gave off a very homey vibe. Definitely a great place to study right off campus to avoid the crowds.
Delicious! We like the Fog Lifter (2 shots of espresso and coffee) and the Red Velvet Mocha. The sandwiches were really good and fresh, too! Recommend the Godfather and the Isle of Capri.
Place has a nice atmosphere and they have Great Wifi. 100 times better than Starbucks!
Such a cozy place inside! All this time I haven't tried it. Nice change from the other!

Mad House Coffee is my go-to spot in the mornings for good reason. The coffee, tea and food are amazing! The employees are always super nice and quick! This morning I really wanted ketchup with my bagel, egg and sausage sandwich but they didn't have packets. The gal who was waiting on me was so sweet, she filled up a little cup with ketchup and put it in a plastic container. Made my morning!!!! She deserves a raise!!
A wonderful combination of friendly staff and variety of flavors make this the best coffee place in town.  I will miss it after having moved out of town.
Making my rounds in my usual bubble and decided to get a change from Starbucks.  So glad I did.  My chai tea was delicious and the service was speedy and friendly.  Thank you!!

Bad service. Got both of my coffee orders wrong and my food order. Lady was rude on the intercom and they took 20 min. This is just another reason why Starbucks does so well.. Always great customer service and your order is always right. Maybe this place should learn a few things from them!!!!

I enjoyed my cup of coffee very much.  It is a nice little study spot.  I don't know if my phone was bugging out or what, but when getting direction from yelp it was taking me somewhere about 1-2 streets down to a medical plaza.  If you use iOS and you're being led somewhere completely off your destination just be aware that there may be an issue with the directions.  If this does happen to you, just know it's on S Eastern Ave and E Pebble Rd.
They have new owners and the atmosphere is really comfortable and cool. Free Internet access with outside tables and the staff is great. Try orange spice tea it's very good.

This place is beyond awesome. It's rare to find a place with this kind of atmosphere to enjoy great food at. It's fun, there's even a wall of boardgames to play with. Its a perfect quite place to sit down and enjoy your morning coffee and or lunch. The clientele is amazing and always serve with a smile, great place.

I've been looking for other coffee options besides the big name one and found this. Been here twice, the first was good and the second they forgot to put cream I asked for.  Frustrating if you drive through.

I have been here twice now and both times were for several hours. The employees are beyond helpful and super nice. The sandwich I ordered today was delicious and the drinks both time were wonderful. Yes, it is pricey, but coffee everywhere is pricey now. And their cups of regular coffee are cheaper than Starbucks. Like nearly everyone has said, the red velvet mocha is to die for. Seriously yummy. Just don't order a large because it is HUGE. 

The only thing this shop could use is more power outlets.

I went back the other day and i have to say i was really impressed...the service was great and the speed of service was amazing......i ordered my usual iced chai and the woman took the time to ask me if i wanted the powder or the liquid and took the time to explain the difference between the two...she seemed to know her stuff....then right after that i got my two croissants and drink....all super fast and with smiles from all the staff...great job management!

The customer service is what really made Mad House Coffee a standout. It was friendly, quick, and accommodating. The location is small and cute, and the beverages pretty good, but the employees are what make Mad House great.

Ahh~ I do enjoy this place.  It's cozy, it's friendly, and they have a great selection for being as small as they are.

The pumpkin spice is leaps and bounds better than Starbucks, so get it while you can!  Their tira misu, while large, does not seem to hit my tira misu mark.  Pastries are fresh and tasty, and everything just tastes like there's TLC actually put into it.

Oh, the artwork in there is pretty fun too.  =)

What a comfortable, cute spot for coffee, tea, smoothies, or juices. It was our first time to Madhouse and we will definitely be back. The bagel sandwiches were fresh and tasted great. The service was quick and friendly. I'm glad we stopped in!

I'm all about keeping the mom & pop shops in business so instead of starbucks I thought I would try Mad House Coffee!!!  Great location!!!  Easy in & out service!!!  Nice on the inside!!!  Was disappoint to pay $6 & some change for a ice latte tho!!!  It was great tasted good but I don't think I will pay that again!!!  Sorry!!!

I go to two locations for It's A Grind, I like it the same. I do like this franchise better than Starbucks. It's A Grind's blended drinks have catchy names, tasty as well, such as the campfire chill, or the famous mocha mint. I feel like this is a chill coffee place, the people who work here are always down to earth. I like going to a place with good vibes, service, and good food/ drinks.

Went to the drive thru and this was my first visit. I had the Grasshopper blended drink and I wish I ordered a larger size! The prices for their drinks are a little high so I won't go too often, but I liked what I got and I want to try other things on their menu. Also, the barista was very nice and I've noticed that they're not too busy in the mornings, so don't worry about getting stuck in line if you're on your way to work or school.

Great coffee !! Its a really good little coffee shop with a drive thru and a dine in cafe .. the coffee is really good .. way better then Starbucks and they also have quick breakfeast sandwiches too .. great coffee with cool flavors !!
Ordered a "dirty chai" hopefully I got that right and omg! It is HEAVEN I love this place.

Let's just say if it were just for the food and drinks it would be 2 stars. The service is awesome so 3 stars.

We had the Groupon for $10 and ordered nutella tiramisu, a chocolate croissant, a red velvet mocha and a monkey mocha. Still ended up paying $8.. a little pricy.

Nutella: I love nutella. I eat it plain. Tiramisu is one of my favorite desserts. I thought this would be a home run. Nope.. awful! Anyone who says otherwise needs to have their tastebuds evaluated. It tastes like expired cream cheese and cocoa with a crumble of espresso soaked ladyfingers. It's bad!

Chocolate croissant: mediocre

Red velvet mocha: AWESOME! It's 2am and I'm considering driving over for another. Best frozen coffee drink of all time. Kudos.

Monkey mocha: I tried it. My brother wouldn't drink it, and he eats anything. It was okay. If you like the artificial banana flavor, you will love it. I think fresh bananas would work much better.

I will be back for the red velvet. Completely worth it. Skip the pastries!
Very tasty cold coffee. Unique. The staff need to be more attentive though. Will go beck for the cold coffee
Passion iced tea....sooo good.  Fast service and really helpful.  Good prices too.  I'll be back soon.

Oh snap, this place is bombtastic. 

I came here once, years ago, in a land far far away and really liked it. Then...I totally forgot about it. I don't know why, because I remember it being great, but I forgot. 

So, like 3-4 years goes by, my baby mama is out of town and I'm taking our little feller to an indoor playground (because it's 1,000 degrees outside). I'm about to drive by this place and I'm like, "yo, I remember that joint, it was bombtastic, I should get a blended iced beverage to help me cool down on this very warm day." Best decision ever.

I went with the Mocha Monkey. The name isn't just awesome, the taste is too. Banana, chocolate, chocolate chips, and mocha blended into a smooth, creamy consistency that I can only describe as a milkshake, but better. I drank this in about 5 minutes. The indoor playground is across the street. I literally had one swig left by the time I pulled up.

So what did I do the next day? Yep. Got another.

Side note...chatted it up with the dude who took my order. We talked about the Golden Knights and how cool it was that they made the Stanley Cup. Friendly fella who made natural conversation, didn't feel forced or like he was pushing for a tip. Appreciated that. 

I'll be back and I won't forget you Madhouse Coffee.

I am from Washington state and have to have my coffee...whenever I am in Vegas visiting my sister this is the only place I go for coffee...it's clean, the employees are knowledgable, and best of all the coffee is delish!!! I get a white chocolate iced blended mocha with vanilla. It tastes like home!

Very nice service and good signature drinks I had the red velvet latte....it was good but I wish there was more of a coffee kick to it, next time I will add a shot of expresso. They haven't stole me from Starbucks, but I will definitely put it in my coffee shop rotation.

I really wanted to like this place.  I'm constantly in search of the anti-Starbucks, the place where consistency and artistic pride live in harmony.  This isn't that place, I'm afraid.  Although the service is very, very friendly, the latte I ordered was nothing more than foamless, warm milk.  Virtually no coffee taste at all.  Suddenly, Starbucks started to look good.

The Madhouse brand cannot be more different when comparing the Eastern location to the Desert Inn location. BOTH are great when it comes to blended drinks, quality of food, and quality of all menu items. 
The Eastern location is far more laid back and inviting to all types of people. I enjoy this location more when I'm just trying to relax or have a conversation! When you want to people watch, DI if far more interesting. 
Madhouse is great! Come enjoy the fun!

While I love the coffee and tea options here it is beyond frustrating that they don't offer gluten free options at this point. Your sandwiches = amazing, but why no gluten free bread option? It is so easy for business to cater to that in this day and age. Everything from fruit and protein box options, eggs and bacon, to bagels and breads can be gluten free. You are a block away from a local gluten free bakery, why not partner with them to offer some pastry options. We like this stuff too, and I hate having to go someplace like Starbucks or coffee bean and tea leaf if I want a snack and drink. I like supporting smaller or more local shops, so it would be nice if local supported me!

Oh man, it has been years since I last visited a Madhouse Coffee. Upon learning that they had a happy hour in between the hours of 5-7 PM, I decided to give it a shot. Coming back was definitely worth it...I forgot how good their coffee is.
Not only they have coffee, they also have sandwiches, smoothies, and mochas.
Employees are always friendly.  Pastries are good.  Coffee is okay.  Prices a little high.

What an adorable and fantastic coffee shop! This is an excellent chance to forgo the hum drum star and get REAL flavor.
I had the Irish Cream Latte iced. So yummy!

Was getting my car worked on across the parking lot and stumbled upon this place. Smelled amazing when i walked in so i figured it was a good choice. Got the croissant with cheddar and eggs,  freshly made on the spot.  Cant beat that.  I will be coming back here from now on,  starbucks no more
Amazing service and fantastic tasting coffee. It is refreshing to find a solid neighbor coffee shop over Starbucks or other similar shops. Looking forward to try some of their pastries!

The grasshopper is a house special. It's made with mint chocolate and coffee. The beauty of coming to a small shop was truly shown here. We came in with a large group on Halloween and they were already slammed. There was only one employee and he was working his a** off. He made a call and within 15 minutes there were 2 more employees there, the owner being one of them. They made our orders and apologized like crazy for the wait. They didn't slack on the quality during this little rush either.  

I tried one of their pantries, the brownie. They warmed it up and served it to me on a little platter. It was pretty tasty. I'll definitely be back.

Hmmmmm the sandwich I had was pretty damn good. But it seems as though that I was the only one that could have eggs on my sandwich though. 

The place was dead and yet they had no eggs. I felt bad for my friend Meg who couldn't get eggs on his sandwich. The coffee I got was huuuuuuge. 

I did also feel that for a sandwich, large coffee, and muffin that $13 is a bit much. 

I also didn't really care for the workers changing the music to something that they wanted to hear. I was getting into the classic rock that was on but then it was gone and Three Days Grace was bumping. 

Sorry not sorry.
Your coffee is good. Huge Harry Potter fan. Loved the details. Wish you guys would put out more. Employee that helped was extremely nice. Thank you!

Meh. Ordered two coffees. Their regular roast was horrible. It tasted like it was made with chlorinated pool water. Also ordered a flavored "flat white" which is a light foam cappuccino. Again, had an unusual metallic taste. Both left quite the aftertaste, as if I just took a dose of Robitussin. 

The service was good, it just doesn't make up for lousy coffee. This location seemed very clean and they had a large variety of flavored syrups and food. 

There wasn't a paper menu to read the descriptions of coffee, so unless you have stellar vision and can read the board above the cashier that's in the smallest font... You're screwed. 

Bleh. Oh well. Off to Starbucks!
They have so many fun flavors and the drive thru is always a plus. Plus they have 32 oz drinks! And although it sounds silly, I love their ice. :)

Customer service is bleh.. I was told my latte would come in a ceramic mug and it did not. I asked for it ice and got attitude. There were flies and no clear place to take care of your plates. I wouldn't sit in if I visit again. Too small of a space. You get to go cups anyway lol... The coffee itself is nothing special.

Mad House Coffee for me was okay. I'm all about going to Mom & Pop-type of coffee shops and not large coffee shop chains or franchises if I have to, and Mad House is certainly fits into the category of a Mom & Pop-type. The venue itself is small, yet there is a bit of seating within the building as well as a 3-4 seats on the outside front portico. There is a drive-thru at this location, for those that are in a hurry. 

The staff here is pretty lively, which makes all the difference. They seem to have fun, in which the vibe just rubs off on you. That alone starts your day a little bit more than the coffee does. The Wifi here is pretty good, and the coffee (I purchased an iced caffeinated beverage) is pretty consistent with anything that a Dunkin or Starbucks would offer. Prices are comparable to the big coffee shop chains, and not ridiculously high or low. It does get loud in here, and you'll have to speak up for the barista to complete your order accurately. 

Not a bad place. Not bad at all.

Always great service!  The staff is always friendly and quick to take and deliver my order.  I love tea and they have a great selection and have even offer to deliver to me when having a busy day.  They always suggest yummy options for different breakfast or snack ideas.   I'm not a coffee fan but the girls in my office say that it is good.  I definetly recommend this local coffee shop for great tea and food!

I'm excited to go back and try Mad House again.  I've only been once and I enjoyed it, but I want to try some of the other things on their menu.  I got one of their sweeter options, going against everything I know I like about coffee.. and sweet is just not me.  Even though my choice was a little sweeter than I would've liked, I still really, really enjoyed it.  

In addition to the coffee, I got one of their almond croissants and that was absolutely delicious.  My friend also really enjoyed what she got.  We tried some of their macaroons and those were absolutely delicious, also!  

The thing I loved most about this place, was the ambiance.  It definitely reminded me of the cafes I would frequent back in New York City.  It is a very chill place I can see myself going to lesson plan and hang out with a good cup of coffee.  They've got cool little murals on the tables and fun game around the place to hang out and enjoy.  We played a quick game of tic tac toe while sipping on our coffee and enjoying our snacks.  

I haven't been back since, but I do plan to try it again and try some more of the options on their menu.  When I do, I'll be sure to update this review with my opinion on more!

I too was also taken by surprise because the free wifi is not Free. You have to buy something in order to get a WiFi Card with password on it. Or you can buy time. Either way it's not Free. Heck I could have went an extra block For Free Wifi
Delicious dark brew and really good sandwiches. I like this place!
Gross... coffee was watered down and there were cigaret butts everywhere. (Sat outside) the place smelled like crap..

My wife and I drove here from the Strip on Christmas Eve to drink a nice cup of latte and to check our emails. There was one person on staff, since it was just before closing. She made an exceptional latte, probably one of the best I've tasted. Great seating and lighting, and if I lived in Vegas, I'd feel blessed that this coffee establishment was in my backyard.

I was on my way to work this morning and thought I would stop by and grab breakfast. I asked for a sausage croissant and was told that it would be a very long wait. I asked how long and he said at least 15 minutes. I asked for tiramisu and they were out. I ended up just ordering coffee. A caramel mocha and a coconut mocha. It took 25 minutes to get the coffee and neither one has whipped cream drizzled with anything like the description stated and neither one of the drinks were labeled. My friend raves about the madhouse in Summerlin but this location just does not have it together.  Will not be going back again. Every single person in the place was angry about how long it was taking to get anything. I saw a group that ordered before me and it took them 20 minutes to get a muffin out of the case and a cup of oatmeal which is Quaker and they only add water to the premade cups. Very dissatisfied.

Mad house Coffee is my new favorite place! I'm so happy my salon moved right behind them and I can enjoy a delicious sandwich or a smooth ice blended beverage whenever I'm at work! Everyone is super friendly and everything is super yummy! Keep it up guys!

I have not been in this coffee house for sometime but I'm glad I stopped by! Since the new owner took over the place is so
Much more cozy and comfortable and you can even feel the happiness in the employees voices! There are more lounging areas outside now. The pumpkin latte was so delicious and the veggie sandwich was the best I've ever had for a long time! Bravo to the new owner! This place is a hit!

This Madhouse is slightly different than it's other independent location on D.I. This location is more quaint, not 24/7, less packed and the menu prices are about $1 cheaper. 

The best part is that they offer the same staple menu items but also offer addition drinks! I.e. I am obsessed with their coconut caramel mocha, a drink specific to this location ONLY. Also, I prefer their pumpkin latte because they add white chocolate powder and it easily tastes like a dessert, rather than just pumpkin. You can omit this if you'd like the classic taste of the pumpkin latte. 

Sign up for Belly and you can accumulate points to redeem in-store!
This was a nice place to go study. Loved my ice tea. Glad to support  local business.

This is my go-to place when I need to get work done but don't feel like working at home.  The staff here is as sweet as you can get; they are always super welcoming, willing to answer questions, and never rush you when you're trying to decide what to pick from their menu.  Speaking of the menu, the coffee is delicious (try a soy au lait on an autumn day) and they make some really excellent sandwiches.  As a bonus, they consistently play 80s and 90s music (for some reason, Nickelback really helps with productivity).
madhouse coffee is my spot when im on this side of town the coffee is good and reasonably priced.  I love the iced chi tea latte and the almond croissant thats my go to order.

What am I doing? I'm in love with Mad House! The almond croissant and Monkey Mocha are amazing here.  OMG it seems like everyday I go through the drive-thru and order my two favorites. Some days they do run out of almond croissant but lately I have been lucky.  I love that almond croissant it's so flakey and the taste of it mmmmmm full of flavor. It has just the right amount of almonds on top of the croissant.   And I wash it down with my Monkey Mocha. Never made my drink wrong just the way I like it. 

The staff is awesome; they don't take forever in making it. This place is awesome for their drinks and pastries. And it's open 24/7!!

Every time I go into Mad House I recieve the same friendly customer service I look forward to. They prepare the food and coffee very promptly and get you on your way. And the price is ver reasonable. Also, if you have a chance to take a trip inside the have many fun board games you can play if you just want to hang out! :)

[edit: i previously posted this review regarding the incorrect location but have since moved it to this section after being notified of my error.]

It's a tiny little spot on eastern, PAST the starbucks at the 215 exit. You might not notice it if you weren't looking for a good coffee alternative to the corporate norm. Lucky for you, I found it and am here to write a review about it.

Like I said, they're tiny. They have maybe 5 -6 tables inside and 2 nice recliners. My master bedroom is practically as big as this place, but that's not such a bad thing. The furniture is moderny throwbacky and the music is alot of throwback eighties electronic and nineties rock-- quite comforting to an ear that its had its fill of top 40 sewage. I put in my ear plugs and sat in a corner and studied moderately well. This is where you go to get away from the people you know studying at the starbucks.

The staff is friendly and willing to help newbs like you decide what to get. On one hot day I decided to try the iced mint mocha, which turned out to be an excellent choice. It was honestly better than just about any frappucino you can get at Starbucks (and I have had them all) though the price isn't much better. 
I've also had their hawaiian dark roast, which had an interesting tang to it. At 2 bucks a medium, it is definitely competitively priced with the corporate big wigs. 

Give these guys a shot. They are small and that's part of what makes them so charming, but more importantly, they offer good coffee with a personalized touch.

First time I've ever seen this place, and first time I've ever stopped. When I'm looking for a quick treat I'll probably stop by again.

I had their crushed coconut mocha which was creamy and delicious. Also grabbed a croissant with apricot and vanilla cream, and that was amazing as well.

It was a little spendy, but considering the price of my favorite Starbucks drink just went up to $5 with tax, this seemed downright reasonable.
Coffee is great. Nice Lil area. When you want to get away from Starbucks busy lines the Mad House is the place to go.

Hands down the best coffee. Ditch Starbucks and come to a place where they put love into their drinks. I had the white chocolate nutella. Amazing!!! I cant stop thinking about this drink you got my business. Goodbye Starbucks!!!! Wont be missing Ya

Chocolate Mocha Blended with Almond Milk is sooooooo gooooood .. Awesome little place with the friendliest staff .. Drive Thru if you're in a hurry otherwise go inside to play some candy land or monopoly while you're  sitting in a super comfy chair.
I used my yelp deal today! I ordered Mad Max and Grasshopper...they both good. Really like Mad Max, so much better than Starbucks Java Chip. It's in my neighborhood, so I will be back.

I really like the Mad Max coffee.  The only reason I'm taking off one star is because it's so dang expensive.  I wouldn't expect to pay more than Starbucks for something that doesn't quite taste as good.  I'm all about supprting local business but it's very very pricey for one coffee.

I love coming to Madhouse for little coffee dates or before school went I attended high school in the area. The drinks and atmosphere deserve 5 stars, but the older man behind the counter in the back room that just sits there and lets the girls in front do everything is very rude and unprofessional, hence the reason for one star lost. The other members of their staff are always friendly and easy to chat with!

I'm addicted to the *bucks and am also chronically late so although I love the ambience of a great coffee shop, it is not a luxury I am afforded. My coffee shops of late need a drive through. Enter MadHouse by my sons school. 

I've even taken to the sandwiches. The Supermodel sandwich is amazing. Also love the Isle of Capri and crossiants. I've been pleasantly surprised by the "special" drinks. I've been offered a CookieMonster, Cake Batter and Red Velvet . . . Although I generally stick with my Carmel macchiato light, I've enjoyed other flavas. 

For the occasional after school treat, Gibson gets a smoothie. It is green tea based so I appreciate the antioxidants in a treat. And they taste amazing. I just wish they had more flavors for the smoothies, although both Mango and Berry are enjoyable.

I have to give this place 3 stars only because of their inconsistency and lack of detail on certain items. I have been coming here for awhile now, and I ALWAYS order a LARGE green iced tea sweetened with honey.... Now, this drink officially got me hooked and I have consistently gone back every single time for the SAME drink, and EVERY SINGLE TIME it is made differently. Sometimes the honey is blended and perfectly sweet, sometimes it's just tossed into the cup randomly dripping down the insides of the cup and then sometimes it looks like the straw was dipped in honey and placed in the cup. I'm not sitting for long periods of time to allow them time to make it fresh either. Honestly, I am not even aware of the process. I am told that it just depends on who makes it... Well, as a coffee house, it should be the SAME process/method every time. There are too many great coffee and tea places in Summerlin to go to... PLUS, the iced tea is $4.87 with tax. That's bananas!
Cute little coffee shop! Stopped in for a quick pick me up of coffee. The staff was very nice, my coffee was perfect, and it is really super cute in there!
Yummy coffee and sandwiches and cute decor. This place has a drive-thru, which is convenient, but I prefer to sit and relax in a coffee shop  whilst ingesting my caffeinated deliciousness.

I love this group of people!  Great HEALTHY food is avail if that's what you want. 
They try to customize your order if you
Ask. They have great coffee and? 
Dog Treats at the drive thru. 

Inside? Table games. Can't beat it for 
Off the beaten path late lunch, mid morning pick me ups. I never go during rush hour so can't comment on peak hours!

What a perfect way to start the day! After tried every coffee in the strip with no luck for something tasty, we decided to look for good place out side in the locals areas - we are very happy to find this place we tasted cold & hot drinks.. That's now my place in Vegas for coffee
The staff is nice. Didn't try anything to eat but ordered a flat white espresso and a monkey mocha. The monkey mocha is sooooo good!
I go to mad house coffee once a week at least. They are always friendly, prompt, and I love the sandwiches. My favorite is the dirty chai iced and unusual suspect sandwich. MUST try yummm
I know I made the choice. but all I have to say is: coffee & sandwich= 11 bucks...and people complain about Starbuck prices...2 Stars because the staff was friendly!

I've been here a few times now and gotta say it's been good stuff. It's a small style coffee shop.  But it brings a nice, cozy feel with board games to play; and a picture Muddy Waters.       My favorite drink so far is the Monkey Mocha, a great chocolate peanut butter drink. But the Grasshopper and the Red Velvet are good ones too.  
    If you're in the area or just love good coffee variety, try it out. And Facial was the best so far, the last time I was there !

We went in as we had a Groupon coupon. Had the red velvet mocha, caramel macchiato and a sausage, egg, and cheddar everything breakfast bagel. It was all good! The staff members were friendly and the atmosphere was nice. Will be back!

I usually go to the madhouse on desert inn but just recently moved into the area. Needed my coffee fix on thanksgiving and was willing to go anywhere but Starbucks. Little did I know I should have picked Starbucks. The baristas at the other location are decent, although this one is far from. I tried some small talk "thanks for being open" and the barista didn't even smile. I'm assuming he was having a bad day. I ordered my normal red velvet frap. The presentation was horrific. No whip cream. No red velvet crumbs. Didn't ask for my name for the order. Just a very bad vibe from the barista in general. I came home and I had slight bubble guts. I understand that you're mad about working on thanksgiving but you still have a job to do. Put on a fake smile at least. Will not be visiting madhouse again, sorry not sorry

Update: 
Not bubble guts - I have straight DIARRHEA. The silver lining is I'll be skipping the carb filled dinner of thanksgiving. Sorry Starbucks for not believing in you.

Great Coffee Shop!!! Great owner and is backed with has excellent staff. When I was first invited here I felt very welcomed. I would highly recommend that you try this place out. Great Food, People, and Drinks!! All they reasons to come back for more!

My cousin recommended this place and I have to admit that they do serve great blended coffee...there jus a little complications from the ordering because there's a new staff in training but it's all good..

Since the last time I came it has changed hands, etc. Today, the guy who helped me was super nice! Im preggers so while i like coffee I tend to avoid coffee while I am in the delicate condition.

He was nice enough to make me a Grasshopper blended without coffee, so its mint and chocolate, basically a shake. Its really rich and sweet but its yummy!

I'll be back and once i can have my iced tea fix daily, Ill Really be frequent!

Seriously the most friendliest coffee shop in town! They were closed, on Christmas Eve at 3:00 PM. They saw me about to leave because I saw the sign that says it's closed, and they stopped me saying they will still make my coffee for me, at 350PM. The barista's name was ANDREW he hooked me up with a couple espresso shots and also a bigger size! I was called into work at the clinic because it was busy on Christmas Eve, Madhouse Coffee saved my life! Merry Christmas!!! Real espresso! Not fake, like Starbucks! I got a blended White Chocolate, delicious !!! Thanks Andrew!!!!

This place is super close to where I live & gym at! I don't know how I never noticed this little gem before. Mad House has definitely gotten a lot of hype, so I figured I'd give it a shot. I ordered the Grasshopper blended, and it is definitely better than any Starbucks drink. Although, I do believe taste wise it is in the same ball park of Coffee Bean. A little pricey, but nothing more expensive than I pay at Starbucks or coffee bean. I also ordered The Wannabe sandwich, and It came out okay. I had high expectations for this sandwich, but It came out rather soggy and more bland tasting than I had intended. Nevertheless, the drinks are amazing!

I was bummed when I found out on my last visit that they no longer offer "free" wi-fi.  Although, they still have wi-fi they give you a password to timed access depending on how much you spend.  It's smart on their part but sucky for the rest of us poor college students.  

Under $1.99 - free 30 min
$2-$3.99 - free 1 hour
$4-$4.99 - free 2 hours
Over $5 - free 4 hours

As I was looking for a coffee bar this business I passed and if it is coffee I want to say I have tried it. Mad House is very inviting and their lobby is so eccentric. There are wild and loud images all over the wall with the music pumping in the background that is modern rap and r&b. I live the Muddy Waters image in the wall. I did not stay long but took in the atmosphere while the barista made my coffee. 

I ended up ordering an Irish cream latte single, but was informed that it only comes in a double size. So why the menu it misleading by 75 cents I was not upset since he told me. The Irish cream latte is good, but not great . It has way too much Irish in it, the sweetness level of it is too much. My son ordered an iced coffee with cream and sugar the balance between his sugar and coffee was much better than mine.

They had just cleaned the coffee pots I guess so I couldn't order coffee at the coffee shop. They literally forgot the order of the person I was with and had to remind them after 15 minutes of waiting.

My Yelp habit has made me branch out a bit and try new places... that is why this morning I drove by the Starbucks I have been to 712863812 times and gave It's A Grind a try. 

I decided to use the drive-thru so no comments on the interior of the shop. There were three cars ahead of me so I had a bit of a wait. When it was my turn, I decided to keep it festive and got a large pumpkin latte. Larges are 24 oz. and cost $5.35

It was a good latte, and service was very friendly, but for the price I can't see myself making it a regular stopping point.

Actually stumbled upon this place on accident, literally.  Had that 2:30 feeling, heading to a Starbucks for some caffeine, and was stuck in traffic.  Stuck in traffic because of a minor accident a block from me.  While waiting in traffic I noticed this coffee house/stand to my right and decided "why not". 

I decided on their drive thru because I didn't feel like getting out of my car.  I ordered just an Americano and it was strong just how I like it.  I might have asked for an extra shot too.  I noticed that they serve a bunch of other things like pastries, sandwiches, all types of coffees, and desserts.  Maybe next time, I will venture out and try something else.

The drive thru is convenient, coffee was good, and service was great.  One issue that I have with the Mad House is that their drive thru menu is so damn high.  Unless you're in a lifted truck, you'll find yourself straining your neck to see what's on the menu.  I can't imagine what those rice rockets deal with at this drive thru.  

I also noticed a Super Burrito next door.  Maybe that's my next stop.

I like it here. It used to be a 24 hour it's a grind, (which I loved) but they closed it out and changed the name to what it is now. It's a step away from starbucks, they have really tasty pastries, the breakfast sandwhiches, and bagels are good, but the only downside is that they're a little greasy. The coffee never tastes like that nasty, bitter, pikes place or bold roast that starbucks offers. Their wifi is timed, but they'll give you more hours if you ask. Their prices are reasonable, and they have two really comfy couches, and standerd sit down tables for everyone else. Small place, but i'd rather go here then sb's.

I've been meaning to try this coffee spot out since I moved back and never seemed to come this direction when I was in need or wanted a coffee, but I finally made the conscious effort and came here a few weekends ago. 

This is a small coffee shop with a few tables outside as well as wicker furniture. The inside is pretty much filled with tables, not much space to move around if there were lots of people on the inside. They have a drive-thru which most people seem to use instead of coming inside. Since it was a hot morning, I decided to have my coffee in-house and enjoy the AC.

Even though this place is small, it was nicely decorated and everything seemed clean. They have a bookshelf full of games for those that want to spend some good time here with friends and have some fun. 

This place has a large menu with lots to choose from. I had a hard time deciding on what I wanted to have. Their hot drinks come in 12 oz/$4, 16 oz/$5, 20 oz/$5.75 and their Over ice & Blended drinks, as well as their Smoothies and Ice Teas, come in 16 oz, 24 oz, and 32 oz. Their prices on those depend on what kind of drink you get. I found that overall their prices are a bit higher than other coffee shops that I've been to here in the area. 

I got the 24 oz Carmel Toe coffee drink which cost $6.25. It was pretty tasty, but a bit too sweet for my liking. It had a lot of caramel flavoring in it that overpowered the coffee taste. Definitely not worth what I paid for it.

The lady that took my order was very patient and knowledgeable of the menu. Since the menu doesn't say what is in each of their drinks she was kind enough to explain what was in the drinks I was interested in getting. My guest got the Peanut Butter blended coffee which was really tasty. They use actual peanut butter and not some flavoring for it and you can tell the difference. A must try for those that love peanut butter. 

Would I come back again? Definitely!!

I wanted so badly to try their Famous Nutella Tiramisu- well it's just my luck that  it wasn't available on the day I went. They had regular and Mexican Tiramisu instead.... I wasn't really into those flavors as I already had my tastebuds ready for the Nutella one. However, I did get to sample the regular Tiramisu and that was OK- I'm not really a big fan of Tiramisu itself but I am a fan of Nutella... I was surprised to see that they also have a Strawberry Tiramisu  - I'd come back to try a slice of that one.

*** Everything could be a bit cheaper if you ask me***

I did notice that they had one Apricot Custard Croissant left- I claimed it and my daughter got the chocolate croissant. I have to say that the Apricot Croissant was hellah yummy....I loved that the Apricot was a bit tangy and the custard was so creamy but more like a pudding than a cream. The croissant itself was delish!!! The Apricot Croissant is a winner in my book....

After eating the Apricot Croissant - the Chocolate croissant was Bleh to me, it didn't compare. I think it lacked Chocolate....
I had a Mango/Green Tea Smothie with Whipped Cream and that drink was sugar overload. WAY TOO SWEET!!!! and I love sweets but damn...
I do want to come back when it's cooler and try their hot chocolate, the cashier said that when the hot chocolate is at room temperature it becomesmore like a pudding, that's how chocolatety it is... Can't wait!!!
This was my first time in here so I had alot of questions and the guy behind the counter tried his best to answer them however the young lady who took over  made me feel like I was holding her up from doing other stuff. I didn't like that at all and they lose a star for service....
Love this place! The coconut crush is my favorite and the staff is really great about being able to customize it the way you want it. Staff is fear and works at quick speed!

I liked this little drive thru....I used to go to it when it was Saxby's and hadn't been there in awhile.  My husband and I stopped thru on a Sunday morning.  The drive thru was fast and easy, as to be expected.  Our drinks were good...my husband loved his white chocolate mocha.  I liked my chai tea latte...it was a little spicy for my normal liking.  The prices are very comparable to Starbucks or Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf.

My favorite Mad House Coffee location is near Desert Breeze Park on Durango...the owner has a French Bulldog that looks just like mine and the seating outside is really nice.

Great eclectic menu of coffee drinks. Small and comfortable. Good sandwiches and great quiche. Love the double fog lifter. Keep going down eastern past sbux and give this place a try for your coffee addiction.

If I were to relate this coffee shop to a game of golf I'd say this shop was a par. Not a birdie and definitely not an eagle (golf terminology! I'm an experienced "wii golfer") but this cup of coffee wasn't bad. My coffee was on the cooler side of warm, not hot, and the syrups they use here are just a bit too sweet and artificial tasting for me. Although, the have a great selection of different kinds of milk like almond, soy and coconut. They also have a fun menu and the staff is very friendly!

This is our second stop here. Love the name, but that is all. 

First stop we went through drive-thru. The barista seemed cool. He was funny, so we were really disappointed when our lattes came out far from hot. 

Today we decided to give them a try, but decided to go inside for our lattes. Two people were ahead of us, and had already ordered. There was nowhere for them to wait, so they were both at the counter. Weird configuration inside. Too many tables. 

We stood there for a minute and decided what we were going to order. There was a barista running the window, and two other employees off to the side. Making sandwiches??? Coffee??? I don't even know. 
None of the three greeted us. 

After waiting for about three minutes with no progress and no greeting, we left. The vibe in there was an unhappy one. No one seemed happy about their jobs. 
I don't know how this place has such great reviews.

This is by far better than that "other" well known chain!! I go here every once in awhile and every time they remember me.. maybe it's because of what and how I order, who knows, but it makes me feel good. Therefore, that alone keeps me coming back, not to mention they have Pumpkin Spice year round...SOLD!!

Looking for a coffee shop on Eastern? Don't get sucked into the newly remodeled 24hr Starbucks, Mad House is only a shopping plaza away. The prices are better, the drive thru is faster and the baristas are friendlier! 
The macchiato I ordered was way too foamy, at least 1/3 of the cup! However, I won't complain since it was only a dollar and some change and also yummy. I probably got more macchiato in my cup than I would have at Starbucks for that price, anyways. 
The shop is a little small, no place for intimate conversations. However, there are always tables and spaces available. Great, quiet place to study!

Pasquale on ciabatta and an iced mad cow (expresso+ hazelnut+cream). Cute place, nice outside patio. Wish they didn't allow smoking though. Their uniforms are god awful too. The cashier wasn't that great when I asked her it was my first time here she said ok take your time and left the counter.. Recommend me something? I don't bite. The menu is extensive. From sugar loaded red velvet blended drinks to protein and "supermodel" sandwiches. I'll be back.

Update: went in at 7am and SKYLAR was awesome! Even though he's a Virgo.


Update: ordered a lox & bagel. Wasn't busy at all. Asked for no onions and then he repeated the order back to me. Saying no onions right? Twice. and I got more onion than anything else. I'm so disappointed. You won't be seeing me anymore. Rude staff. I walked in to no acknowledgement and there are 4 other people in here with me. The cashier has this gnarly cut on his arm and its bleeding. What the hell

OK. Another update. The coffee is so good I can't stay away. No-lo (sp?) and Skylar (again) were AWESOME!!!! They made my day so much better. Super cool and courteous. They immediately recognized me as the girl with the onion problem and gave me a discount for my trouble last time. AND made the best lox& bagel I've ever had. I'm full and I'm drooling at the thought of putting my lips to another one! GREAT STAFF! Their customer service is impeccable. And fast! Management did a great job at keeping their regulars happy. And be sure to wish Skylar a happy retirement from the coffee shop. We'll sure miss you!

I would give them 10 stars if I could , drove by this place with my dad & decided to try it instead of going to Starbucks like we always do . EXTREMELY happy we took the chance , the cashier was super sweet and helpful . They have such unique , delicious sounding drinks and surprisingly in August offered pumpkin spice so of course I ordered that knowing Starbucks wouldn't have it until the fall . I got a small nonfat iced psl & after the first sip wish I would've gotten a large . My dad got a hot red velvet latte and it tasted better then any red velvet cake I've ever had . If your looking for coffee with light flavor I would opt for one of their unflavored drinks but if your looking for dessert in a cup you've come to the right place . I will definitely be back to try their other coffees , and I can honestly say after these two drinks madhouse has the best coffe I've ever had .

The first time I came, I loved the red velvet latte!  Unfortunately, it seems like there's no consistency, and depending on who is making the drink, the taste can dramatically change.  I've had some delicious red velvet lattes, to some that felt like a waste of money :(

Ordered a triple latte and expected to receive a 20 oz. drink, which is what the huge sign above counter said.  But what I received was obviously much smaller. So I pointed it out and asked them to correct it.  I was given a larger cup and went home to enjoy my coffee.  But it still looked way too small. So I measured it out and turns out they had put it in a 16 oz. cup.  I went back, measuring cup in hand, and they tried to blame it on the cash register and then the owner, (all the while the manager is telling me how nice she had been to me earlier.)  Needless to say she was quite rude and simply told the barista to give me a medium to make up for the difference-he by the way was very nice and I felt badly for how she spoke to him.  
   I work for at s high-end hotel and know all about how to give good service and get repeat customers.  And although the coffee was great I won't be in any rush to go there again.
First time at madhouse coffee absolutely amazing staff coffee and pastries were all delicious. The spot off Decatur is 24 hours and has hookah!

My favorite coffee shop!!! Only downside is not opened very late. So many selections, good quality (not mass produced gross Starbucks coffee). So much variety when it comes to food AND drink. Cute decor. Friendly staff.

Absolutely the worst cup o coffee in the Valley. I stop here when Satrbucks is too busy but not any more. Their coffee is stored in the same bins that flavors coffee is stored in and their beans are always way over roasted leading to a very vanilla-y foul cup of brew. Shame on you guys.

The workers are really nice, but the drinks weren't that great. I got a Chai tea latte, which was kinda like flavored warm water. The atmosphere is okay, but if you want a relaxing seating environment for more than 2 friends then you might want to find a bigger cafe.

The only complaint I could possibly give this establishment is why can't you be open 24/7 or have later hours?! I cannot even explain how much I love all of their products. My go to, Mad Max is delightful. I live nowhere near this location, but I frequent here often. Also, I SO wish they had a stamp card rewards system, like Grouchy John's or other coffee shops.

Aside from their display counter usually being in disarray or empty of yummy baked goods and their sandwiches lacking any greens, I can say I'm totally addicted to the iced chai, their drink sizes, and the prices!  Also convenient location.

Husband gets hot coffee and loves it. I go for iced and I swear I can't tell the difference in taste between the 5 different drinks I've ordered. Food is sub par, especially compared to the location in spring valley. But the absolute worst here is the customer service. Such a bummer because it's in such a convenient location.

A hidden gem which is not actually hidden, but always seems to never be crowded but has a steady stream of business.  I like the fact they have organic items there and even though it is not very big inside, it is very warm and a friendly environment.

Stopped in to have a meeting with a friend and it was nice and relaxing to just sit with a cup of coffee and enjoy the atmosphere.

I have never tried the sandwiches there but a lot of people came in and ordered food and the food look amazing.

I like this place better then the other bigger chains as the coffee and tea selection here is better, healthier and the staff are very friendly.

Lately my mom and I have been coming here since I always come with friends and its a nice place with great drinks and food. But this morning we went and had a unpleasant experience. My mom ordered a chai latte as usual and told the barista "very little little ice" because her teeth are sensitive and in the past that hasn't been a problem. Another barista brought our drinks out and hers was full of ice. It wasn't busy we were the only ones there. My mom asks if they can dump the ice out.
