The girl offered to remake it but kept cutting my mom off and acting like it was no big deal. So she brought it out with no ice and my mom thanked her and said she hated to complain, and before she could finish the girl cut her off saying "its fine now! I remade it!" Like that was unnecessarily rude. No need for attitude. This is the first time in YEARS that any of the staff have been rude to us. I won't be coming back for awhile.
Bummer...good passionfruit iced tea but they advertise as 24 hours on web site and door but kicked me out at 10:30?!?! Lame!  I should've driven 2 more seconds to the 24 hour Starbucks!

I got tired of the line at Starbucks. So it forced me to try something else. I was in a hurry and decided to try Mad House. I always eat next door at Super B, but never tried the coffee here. I get my usual hot Cafe Americano w/ white mocha, and it was really good.

I did not make a mistake. Service was excellent, the coffee is excellent and I seen the Nutellamisu. My wife would love to try this. I'm going to surprise her one day with it. It looked so yummy, but I had to resist till next time.

I found a new coffee joint, I still love starbucks but the line hurts when your in a hurry.

Wish this place could take over Starbucks! AWESOME coffee with a fun atmosphere love the fact that they were putting in the tea selection!!!! Definitely a place I love to enjoy a cup of coffee or a yummy frap!!!! You must try it!!!

Friendly! The staff is attentive!.. We had an order confusion and they just packed the wrong ordered sandwich to go, no charge.
The wait wasn't to bad.. They had games and ceda to keep occupied. 
And oh yea! The white mocha I had was delicious! Had the innocent bystander sandwich wasn't necessarily a turkey breast..(as stated on menu) But turkey breast slices. I was still pretty good, looks small but filling, on ciabatta bread. 
My husband had the strawberry smoothie it was a very large sized. No complaints. He also had the breakfast egg and cheddar with sausage on a bagel .. He said it was fresh! As he bit into you could see how hot it was. Another thing they had were *fresh* in store baked macaroons. That's what the menu states,.. But not sure how fresh they were, as they were pretty frozen.?? Don't know much about macaroons but they were true to taste of flavor! I'll definitely be back for coffee!!

Variety is the spice of life. Mad House Coffee has a large variety of coffee flavored syrup. Mad House Coffee is to coffee houses what Baskin Robins is to ice cream.

 When I want to add some spice to my morning before work, I check in to the Mad House. My caffeinated beverage is a medium coffee with a flavored syrup.

  The flavored syrups personalize the coffee drinking experience.  If I want to feel tropical, I get pineapple syrup. If I want to feel peachy, I get peach syrup. If I want to feel nutty, I get coconut syrup.  If I want to feel conservative,  I get the classic syrup. If I want to feel satisfied,  I get the strawberry syrup.

  I also check in at the Mad House for my caffeine boost before work. If I were to compare their coffee to gasoline,  it would be 93 octane. It is a level of caffeinated fuel to turbocharge me in the early morning and have me bouncing through the leading hours of my eight hour shift.

 When I drink coffee here, I am sitting inside a former It's A Grind on the northwest corner of Eastern at Pebble. It is close enough to Interstate 215 to be on my "Exit off the 215" list.

  The shop is relatively small. It isn't really cozy or hip like Grouchy John's. When I spend time, I hear the uptempo 80s songs playing on their music system. I have had zero issues getting a table. I am usually the only patron sitting inside.

  It is a good thing that Mad House is not busy. Everytime I have been there, one employee has been running the shop and drive thru. That person also cooks the sandwiches and cafe food.

  Before work I need to add some spice to my morning and high octane caffeinated fuel to my body. Before an 8 hour shift at a real mad house, I will be checking in to this Mad House.

Yelp Challenge Review 39 of 100.

I was expecting more of a bakery, but it is primarily a coffee shop that serves a small selection of baked goods and sandwiches.  We ordered a pair of blueberry muffins, a coffee and a chocolate chip cookie.  The muffins were nothing special, the coffee was good and they initially forgot to serve me the cookie.  I ended up with both my original cookie plus a second one as an apology.  The cookies were mediocre and very much overpriced unless you get a 2nd one free.  LOL

Overall, it was an okay experience but not one I expect to experience again.

A rating of 2.5 would be more appropriate.

I drive by this place a lot and not sure why I haven't stopped by. Well I finally did and was immediately greeted by a very happy and helpful young lady. I asked if they have nitro brew, but they didnt. They did have a cold brew so I was cool with that. Asked for half and half and for it to be unsweetened. The sugar and add ons were on a table to the right when you walk in. She let me know it was happy hour too so my drink was 20% off. Cool!  Drink came up fast and I started to go to the add on station. I think she was the only worker there, buy as she was cleaning the tables, she asked if my drink was ok and if I needed anything else. I didn't, but that was nice. The cold brew was tasty, bold, and not too strong. There are big comfy chairs to sit on if you wanted to chill. The tables have these bright fun artwork on it so it has an indie vibe overall. There is also a drive through too.  Definitely will be coming back.
Great place to kick back and have some fresh brewed coffee.

Not sure I'll be returning. I'm not quite sold on this place or deterred so I may give it one more shot because I want to give it a shot as small local coffee shop. Maybe I've just ordered the wrong things. Of the 3 out of 4 items I've had, 3 were gross. The time I stopped for a bagel sandwich and 2 shots of espresso over ice with almond milk. The bagel sandwich was soggy, bland and rubbery. The drink was great. Then, last week I stopped for an early lunch. I ordered the "Wannabe" which wasn't my favorite name for a sandwich but sounded good. It was not. I was in a hurry and ended up waiting over 20 minutes for it. And it wasn't worth the wait. Again, it was rubbery. I learned it was because of the use of a microwave. The ingredients don't taste high quality.... I accompanied it with an iced green tea that was really an iced water with a tinge of green. You could barely taste that green tea was even brewed near the cup let alone in it. Because it's a drive thru and it's a local place, I may give it a final 3rd... 3 strike your out at some point... And try another coffee. Definitely not another food item. But if it doesn't redeem itself. It will be coming off the list of coffee stops.

I just ordered an order from uber eats I really love this place this was my 4th time ordering from this place since they have great vegan options by today will be THE LAST DAY. I ordered a vegan stuffed sweet potatoes I did receive this in time and the driver was great but the food it self had a plastic film in it I took two bites and there was a plastic film in my mouth it was so gross.....  definitely a let down this place was one of my favorites not anymore. 

NOT THANK YOU
Red velvet latte is good but not worth going back just so the cashier can be rude again for no reason. Better customer service would be great.

Needed some energy before getting on the freeway and heading across town, but we worried that it was too late since it was about 5 min. before closing. Not the case!! We were greeted warmly and served generously. And the coffees, amazing!!

How is this place still open?? They never have any food in stock and they served me old looking nasty tasting eggs. My coffee drink tasted like straight sugar. The older lady that works there needs to stop giving BS excuses on why the food is nasty tasting. Anyway overall : Gross food/drinks and really crappy customer service!
Personally my favorite coffee in las vegas! they have a great variety to choose from, and its open 24/7! one of the best ones it the coconut latte or the nutella. food is very great tasting also!

They have many options for vegans, they have both soy milk and almond milk. They are able to make almost any drink vegan and it's not at a steep price either. It is a good alternative for Starbucks if you are looking for some different options, at Starbucks you are somewhat limited if you don't consume dairy products. At MadHouse you have a variety of drinks you can choose from. I was also told recently that they were trying to introduce some more vegan friendly food. Their drive thru is around the back, you can miss it easily.

cute adorable and hidden.  you could drive by it if you weren't looking.  tucked behind the supe burrito on Pebble and Eastern.  very small interior with tons of table games for your use. Perfect quiet hideaway for reading

Been here multiple times and the recipe is always the same:
Good coffee, okay food, bad customer service. 

I appreciate you not giving me a receipt in the drive thru, but I shouldn't have to ask for my card back or how much you charged on it. I understand everyone has a bad day, but it seems like every person working the drive thru has perpetual stinkface. Also, this last time, my fiance had two hairs in his breakfast sandwich. Hate to say it, but after today, I'm finally done with this place.

I only had a blended peanut butter drink here and a house coffee, but both were to my liking.  The ambience is very relaxing and unique. It feels homey with comfy chairs. I usually feel odd hanging out places if I'm not a regular but this place was welcoming. Only reason I haven't been back is because I moved out of the neighborhood. Would definitely go if in the area and wanting a cup of coffee.

I like to pay for real fresh coffee and so I stepped into this place to see if they had a real barrister or if this was kinda like the other places...

Not bad, great service and friendly. Seemed to be small mom and pop place so it is both homey and quirky.

Location - Easy to get to, on northwest corner of Pebble and Eastern.

Parking - Easy

Drive Thru - Yes

Coffees - My only issue is that for a regular brewed coffee, it is already in pots that you pump and poor to your cup. I tend to prefer freshly, immediate brewed coffee. It is hotter and absolutely fresh. So, in this case, it was not up to my normal preference. Note to self, it is very rare to find a coffee place that will serve you fresh brewed coffee.

Pricing - Pretty good, 2.00 for a regular cup of coffee.  

Nice ambiance, so overall worth it. 

GK says, not bad.

I've only been here twice, but I love it!

The atmosphere is urban and laid back. I feel super comfortable spending time there compared to other cafes. It's very relaxed~ I love the artwork that is displayed and the option to purchase them. 

The vanilla lattes are delicious. I have yet to venture and try the food.

I will definitely be back to this coffee shop often :)
I like this little shop. Has a great vibe to it and delicious coffee. The tables have crazy artwork that is my style.

I checked this place out on a Sunday because my normal spot is closed on Sunday's. Bonus right off the bat! Mad House is a small, but funky coffee shop which I LOVE! They have comfy chairs and brightly colored tables. I was greeted by a friendly staff that was ready to take my order. I got my usual large ice coffee with cream and sweet N low. I was very impressed that they asked how many sweet N lows I wanted in my coffee and they put it in for me. I was shocked when they brought me out my coffee, talk about LARGE! It was huge! This is my kinda spot! For $3.19 I had a huge cup of ice coffee!  Not to mention this is the same price I pay at Starbucks for the same thing just not as large. 

Mad House also had a huge list of delcious sounding sandwiches and some tasty looking pastries that I will have to try on my next visit. I also was shocked at their selection of sugar free flavors for your coffee. 

I can't wait to check this place out again for more coffee and maybe a sandwich. Good job Mad House you totally won me over!

Great place to get some work done. Great employees too. I ordered a drink and I was rung up cash instead of with a card. They gave me the drink for free due to the mistake. It was unnecessary but much appreciated. Reading the reviews here, I can see Madhouse really takes care of their customers. I will make this a frequent stop of mine for work and coffee.

I love this place so much better than Starbucks with so many unique and unheard of mixes for drinks. The two young ladies working this morning were so sweet and personable unlike the other location we go to. I will def be coming to this location more often. 

The red velvet blended and the chunky monkey iced are amazing !

Overall good coffee this time around and good service.  I only wish I could find a more reasonable mom and pop coffee house.  The big coffee chain set the tone for over pricing. Now all privately owned places charge just a tiny bit less. I would come here daily if it were priced lower.
Coffee flavors are unique & very good very impressed super good for the price & selection this place gets an A

There should be a Madhouse Coffee in every neighborhood, where blended drinks, coffee and delicious sandwiches are served with a smile.

Madhouse is close to where I work, so it's must go for me when I need a quick bite to eat.
The staff are have always been friendly and courteous. 
I like the eclectic theme with art paintings on the wall and tables decorated with a different piece of art.

Favorite coffees: Cafe Mocha, Caramel Macchiato, & chocolate iced coffee.
Specialty Drink: Italian Hot Chocolate, its like drinking a chocolate bar.

Favorite sandwiches:
Island of Capri
Mozzarella, tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, oregano & evoo

The Wannabe
Grilled breast of chicken, basil pesto, provolone & lettuce

The Green Card
Roasted turkey breast, crisp bacon, guacamole.
Really good selection at reasonable prices. Great coffee. They have a drive thru. Way better than Starbucks. Support this business !
Delicious coffee, yummy breakfast sandwich and the customer service was great. My one and only complaint is that there were no high hairs :(

This place is trash. Just like their staff & menu items.

This place was alright at first. I kept giving it chance after chance. But I've had enough. The workers are very unprofessional and rude. One particular female working there just has a very impolite attitude. Don't use their drive thru, One SMALL latte will take more than 10 minutes. Also they've overcharged me on multiple occasions. So I started asking for my receipts from then on because they don't even give you one or ask if you'd like it. They will tell you a price but apparently isn't what they charge you. Customer service is what drove me away. Sometimes they don't even have what's on the menu.... umm okay? Their drinks and food is alright but it's overpriced. It's not worth your money my friends, just go somewhere else
Omg. I've yet to have a coffee from here I don't like. :) their apple cinnamon muffins are good too.
Very friendly,helpful employees. Had the house coffee and wife had a vanilla latte with coconut milk. Both very good, Nice comfy,sitting places :)

Worst experiences ever here. 

Slowest drive thru. Waited 15 minutes for one mocha. They even asked me what I ordered after waiting 10 minutes waiting outside. They made my order. 

I used Eat24 to order ahead recently. When I showed up to pick up the order they hadn't even received it yet. They first told me I ordered from the other location. They told me. Not asked me. I showed the receipt and the correct address. They asked me to pay in cash or card. I was not going to pay twice for my drink! They did NOT believe I even ordered. I started to get the feeling they thought I was trying to scam them! They phoned Eat24 and so did I. I wanted a refund, after 45 minutes on hold, EAT24 confirmed the restaurant should've received the order. They refunded me. This staff working were condescending and made me never want to come back to this establishment. 

I probably never will.

Cute little coffee shop with exceptional customer service. They are close to my work and the coffee definitely helped my coworker and I wake up. I ordered the Nutella White Mocha and it definitely worked its wonders!

What a cute place! I was visiting relatives in the area and we went here to grab coffee and breakfast. The egg sandwich I got on a bagel was HUGE and tasty, but it was pretty greasy. The coffee is really good and the service is fast and friendly. I recommend it!

I quite enjoy their iced lattes - the Irish cream is my favorite and my to-go item every time I roll in physically (not really roll but you get what I mean) and roll in through the drive through.

However my last time here, going through the drive-thru I ordered the Hot Matcha Latte and I received the right order but their matcha is different and definitely unique. Not my thing but it's Acai Matcha? where in the end pretty much tasted and smelled like a blueberry muffin. Getting a 20oz of it was a big mistake and couldn't finish it just cause it wasn't my cup of tea.

My drink itself costed close to $8.00 - I'll stick to my usual next time

Great alternative to the dark side of coffee(SBucks). The coffee is brewed perfectly and the flavor from their beans is smooth and delicious. They have a drive thru which moves quickly and the inside is welcoming and staff is efficient. This is my new go to place for coffee before work and in general.
Awesome coffee, great sandwiches!  I recommend madhouse coffee to everyone!!!!!!!!!!!! Always great service!! Love this place!
I love this coffee shop! Doesn't taste burnt like Starbucks. The place is a little small, but I love that you can get it for here, in a ceramic mug. Super delicious!

I am convinced that there are certain cursed locations in Las Vegas, this being one of them. No matter what goes up in these areas of town, they are replaced just as quickly. Perhaps all the Starbucks makes it difficult to stay in business, because the customer service is spot on. Is this the second or third coffee shop to open at this site?

The employees here are wonderful. When I went in to ask for more ice in my passion fruit ice tea, I also got a top off with more of the fresh brewed stuff.  Also stole a few sips of a friends coconut mocha ice blended and it was delicious. It is not as sugary as a frappacinno, but there is no pretending that you cannot taste the fatty goodness. They also have Italian style drinking chocolate, I will wait until the winter to get that, because a thick, hot drink does not sound pleasant right now.
Nice little place to get a cup of coffee and get away from things.  Staff are alway nice and friendly.

Don't get me wrong I love this place. But when I drive 20 mins from my house to study here and pay for very high priced coffee I expect for there to be wi-fi (which is broken at the moment) . I was really bummed out by that. If they fixed their wifi situation I would've given 5 stars because even though overpriced, the coffee is good , the vibe is nice, and they are open 24 hours.

Was running errands before work in the area so I decided to try a new spot. I was running way early for work so I decided to go inside although they do have a convenient drive thru as well.

As soon as I walked in I received a warm welcome from the guy behind the counter. He asked if I had been there before and offered a couple of suggestions so I didn't have to stand there long trying to quickly decipher the menu. I went for an iced nuts and berries with an add shot. Quite tasty and hit the spot! They also had a nice selection of tasty sounding options as well.

This place isn't on my normal route from home to work but I will definitely keep it in mind and come back when I am in the area again and looking for a fix. I want to try the food next time as well.

Grabbed a quick coffee and smoothie. 
Nice little coffee spot that's not a giant chain store. 
 They're good for sandwiches, pastries, smoothies, and everything coffee. 
 The tables have neat art on them and they have a bookshelf full of games to play if you choose to stick around. If your on the go they have a convenient drive through window as well. 
 Nice to see more small name local coffee shops popping up!!
Food was ight but workers gave a good vibe 10/10

Love  this place for no hassle quick latte runs. Never along wait and a Great selection of specialty coffee and lattes, a huge step up from starbucks. If you have time to hangout they have a cozy indoor space which you can stay and sip your latte in peace. They also have board games for the more adventurous. If you are staying for a while, they have breakfast in the form or to order and pre thought out sandwichs, egg options and danishes and croissants. 

This place is never overly crowded which is nice, sometimes in the morning it is, but then it calms down. Also if pressed for time the drive thru is always an available option which is unique for specialty coffee shops.

My favorite drink here is a pumkin spice white mocha, I get it hot with non fat milk and it is always delicious.  Some places make their to go drinks different from drinks to stay. Not the case here thank goodness.  

Overall this  is one of my favorite local coffee shops, I frequently go here and would recommend this place to anyone in the area. Great find.

We ordered Tea and a Coffee the Barista Brina was very informative and gave suggestions for both items we ordered . The excellent service and quality is what will bring us back. Thank you for a great cup of Tea and Coffee.

Apparently I have a serious coffee shop fixation! I have always been on a hunt for delicious coffee and since I have been avoiding dairy, my coffee adventures have expanded greatly. My two favorite places in vegas for #vegan coffees are sunrise coffee and madhouse. Madhouse has an incredible selection of whole coffee beans to choose from as well as the option of almond milk in any of their lattes. They have an array of breakfast sandwiches and baked goods (not vegan) and a few umpqua oats you can have prepared there. Oh... And did I mention a drive thru?! 
Try their mad cow with almond milk, delicious.
Great sandwich and great coffee smooth jazz and a accommodating staff , will definitely be back soon
I just came by for the first time & the staff was great.  Andrew was very helpful & knowledgeable about his coffee products.  Kudos & keep up the good work!

This place offers some great items on their menu at a great price. I really like the Mad Max and my GF likes the spiced chai tea. Only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because I could never figure out what time they were open. Seemed like everyday they closed at a different time, even if I went the same day on the next week. They put up a banner by the sidewalk that stated they were open 24 hours a day and when I called to confirm the worker told me they closed at 10pm. A few days later they removed the 24 hour banner. Seems like they finally straightened up their hours and close at 10pm now. So they lose a star because of that. Would be even better if they were open 24 hours like their other location and like their banner stated for some time.

I keep trying to give this place a chance, but cant after my experience today. the drive thru is extremely slow. I was the third car and I waited 12 mins to actually get my drink in hand. now the drink. Stopped by this coffee shop while visiting family in NV.  There wasn't any other customers when we went in, but I'm pretty sure it had to do with it being Thanksgiving day.

There was only one employee working, but he was super nice and gave us the regular low down on new drinks they had.  He was sorry when the cash register wouldn't open up, but it didn't take much time to fix it.

They had tons to choose from and they were kinda fun names.  I went with the monkey frapp.  It was a banana, mocha, and peanut butter hold the whip.

It was super good!  

The wife got the grasshopper frapp and that was very tasty as well.  

We stopped by on the way out of NV and will continue to go whenever we visit.

Disgusto barfo. Never eating here again.

My breakfast sandwich had GREENISH GREY scrambled eggs & my "smoothie" tasted like a blended fruit roll up. 

Ugh.
Quickly becoming my go to coffee place when I visit Vegas. Great coffee friendly staff.
I ordered the 'wannabe' sandwhich  flavorful delicious and quick had a coffee drink there a week ago so i had to come back

My first time here was a great experience. Both of the staff were very friendly & helpful. 

Looney Tuna on focaccia: fresh and tasty. Excellent!

Madhouse chocolate: excellent thick hot chocolate. Just had to try it even though it is 105+ degrees today at lunchtime. 

Highly recommend & I'll be back.

Fast-food, Starbucks feel. If the focus is on coffee, they have a variety of espresso, specialty, brewer, and iced drinks, with a food menu.  Customer service was poor in my first visit with no offer in suggestions of menu items.  There is a sign with The Best of Las Vegas in 2010, but should I care to say that it is now 2017?? 

3.5/5 stars

This place is not bad. I have had better coffee.. Their pastry is really good , in fact every time I drive past this place I remember the really good almond filled croissant I had there. The other thing I also remember is the terrible iced mocha they made me the first time I went there. Im not into blended milkshake coffee, or really sweet coffee. I ordered a small mocha. It tasted like a glass of sugary chocolate milk. Not coffee. The lady making it put like four large scoops of some kind of mocha powder. Didnt care for it. I kindly asked her to re-make it, using only half a scoop. She did and it was much better. But overall I do not prefer powdery substances in my coffee...
Awesome sauce. A nice and different coffee House experience with sandwiches and pastry items.

I'm always trying support locals as much as I can so I'm glad I found a neighborhood coffee shop near by.  The staff are very friendly, the place is clean and quaint. Coffee is good too! It's right next to my gym so it's a good spot to hang out as well. I wish they would have more vegan options on the menu or bakery!

Great coffee, comfortable atmosphere, a good place to just hang out, free wifi love this place! The blended Monkey Mocha w/ whip cream is my fav so good!! Kinda bummed they don't have the apricot croissants anymore though, but they do have chocolate

I was on this side of town for a meeting and this was the closest coffee spot. I was in the mood for a latte so I thought I'd give this other Mad House location a chance. 

The venue itself is pretty cute. Small and filled with tables high and low. The outside has padded wicker furniture inviting you to sip some espresso while reading a good book. The gentlemen behind the bar were busy cranking out drinks for their drive thru customers but did stop to greet me and take my order, a small almond milk latte. 

I planned on enjoying the coffee in house but the employee walked the drink out to me in a to-go cup. The cup was 1/4 foam which was super bubbly and also fell about 1/2 inch below the rim of the cup. It also tasted like raspberry syrup. Maybe they didn't rinse the pitcher while steaming the milk? Not sure. They were kind enough to remake my drink but it came back to me with the same result. 

Mad House isn't cheap and for the price I expect a higher quality of drink. The venue is totally welcoming and somewhere I could see myself hanging out but I came for the coffee. Fingers crossed for a better experience if I make my way back.

I really like the coffee here. The have some unique drinks. One of my favorites is the spicy Aztec mocha. They are more expensive than Starbucks and the wifi setup is a little goofy. You get a card with a code good for a period of time based on how much you spend. Spending over $5 gets 4 hours of wifi.

This place is great!  They have a drive thru, which is great and convenient.  They have a wide variety of drinks that aren't even listed on the menu outside.  If you go inside, you can see them in more detail.  The prices and options are way better than Starbucks!  They also have good sandwiches as well.

I'm not a caffeine addict, but on the rare occasion that I'm in need the quicker the better. This was the main selling point of Mad House Coffee. They have a drive thru and when I'm in need of caffeine, I need it immediately. 

Service was swift and I was in and out in 5 minutes. Sizes are on the large size. I ordered large without thinking about it and received a 32oz iced chai latte, which was a little on the large size for me. Prices were good and flavors seemed reasonable. I wouldn't hesitate stop by Mad House again if I'm in the area.

This is the best coffee house so far that I've been to last week.  They have so many choices it was hard to decide but I tried the fat free-sugar free hot white mocha.  It was creamy and extra extra hot!!!  I love that, can't stand places that give you warm coffee.  They also order kool things to eat and have internet available.  The male server was great, had my coffee done in a flash!  I will definitely return and recommend this place!!!

I've come here a couple times , always hoping the service would be better... the coffee is great! Irish cream iced coffee is the best ! But it always takes forever for just one ice coffee. The baristas never seem to be happy , mostly just distracted in their own convos. Coffee is good, not the service .

Ordered a mocha espresso and was satisfied.  A pretty standard commercialized "coffee spot" with an average menu of over sweetened selections.  Not saying its bad in any way, just not the authentic selection of bean quality and brewing styles I always hope to see.
